Et j'ai compris d'où vient le problème : les stats n'ont aucun fichu lien avec la fin désiré !

Par exemple, j'avais boosté l'intelligence au maximum pour la faire devenir scientifique. Or, avoir une intelligence au-dessus de 500 est inutile pour cela ? Alors pourquoi fixer une limite à 999 ?

39424744.review:
Este juego es peor que la heroína.

Ya había jugado a este título tiempo atras en una versión pirata y realmente ahora que lo vuelvo a jugar me doy cuenta de que este es el juego más adicitvo que eh provado en mi vida, no es una obra de arte, ni un juego perfecto, pero esa necesidad o esa inquietud de saber en quien se combierte tu hija es algo que poco a poco consumirá tu alma.

El juego principal que va de organizar el horario de tu hija e intentar que poco a poco vaya ganando reputación en la sociedad, ya sea ganando concursos o hablando con gente importante. Pero vamos con lo raro, hay pildoras para agrandar los senos de tu hija y de hecho te dan un logro si estos llegan a cierto tamaño, también hay una especie de modo de juego del estilo de los primeros Final Fantasy en el cual puedes matar a un señor de la guerra, o que incluso te puedes casar con tu hija, adémas de ponerle ropas sugestivas, sí, creo que destaca que es japonés. Lo que no se nota es que es del mismo estudio que creo Neon Genesis Evangelion (yo tampoco se porque hicieron un videojuego de hacer princesas).

Creo que dejando aparte los puntos malos que se van ganando con el paso del tiempo, destaca mucho una cosa que pasa en este tipo de cosas y son los complejos sistemas de atributos, el juego te muestra una parte de estos pero solo es la más simple, cosas como la fecha de nacimiento o el tipo de sangre también dictan los atributos que tendra tu hija, y siento que el juego depende mucho de que lo jueges varias veces para que llegues a comprenderlo mejor.

La verdad es que Princess Maker 2 es el mejor de la trilogía y es un valor con un altísimo valor rejugable (lo que ahora importa mucho) y lejos de los fallos que destaque es un buen juego que si te gustan los simuladores, los rpg y los juegos con muchísimas posibilidades, lo más probable es que este juego te guste.

TL;DR: The game's okay, but there is regular sexualization/objectification of your child throughout the game, which you can do almost nothing about.

Ok look: I've done several playthroughs and a few aborted ones. At first this game was interesting and it was kinda cute. It wears off after a time. I tried to come back after a few weeks, same thing. The game gets to be dull and pretty tedious, but this isn't my main problem with the game. I wouldn't have bothered to come and review it just for that. 

My real gripe is how throughout the game, everyone was sexualizing/objectifying my daughter. Even MORE once she turns 15. You can't get access to the best clothes unless she's around 90lbs (even as a full grown 18-year old). Some of the dresses have her almost nude (google siren's robes). Others are thinly veiled dom/otherwise sexy outfits. She's a child. In the desert area, there's a dragon who will constantly comment on my daughter's chest and gives her money scaled to how busty and sexy she is. Father-daughter conversations with her often touch on her asking you about her "proportions" - even when she's 11 years old. At 15, if she has high charisma (which is high-key code for sexual attractiveness), grown-ass married fathers will proposition your daughter to be their mistresses. She's a child. She's a damn child. It wears on you after awhile.
If you enjoy the game and want to play it, that's fine. But for those of you who would rather not have everyone talking perverted crap regularly about your daughter in terms of her body, this is your heads up.

36160540.review:
Gods give you a little girl and you can do whatever you want with her for like 8 years. That's pretty much Princess Maker 2 in a single sentence.

Every month, you have to choose 3 things that your daughter will spend her time on. You can make your daughter work at a job, which will boost her stats and make her stressful in exchange for money. Each job boosts different stats and requires different stats to do well in. With your child labour-earned money, you can send your daughter to school, where she can learn to fight, to not be an asshole, to cook or that the Earth isn't flat. The lessons cost money and if you run out, you just wasted day(s) of time doing nothing. Some paths of education will earn you a rival or result in being challenged while you're out shopping for a winter coat. You can also go adventure in 4 different locations. Adventuring is like your typical old-school RPG: You walk around, randomly encounter people or monsters and you get to choose if you want to talk/fight/ignore/hide. You'll also find chests with items, and there are various NPCs and hidden events in the wild. You can get perved on by an old dragon if you're old enough. You can challenge the War God to a fight. You can find and arrest a wanted criminal. Or you can just run into angry mermaids that have boobs and nipples and will always fight you.  Lastly, you can reduce your stress levels by giving your daughter free time or going on a vacation. Going on a vacation will cost more money, be more effective, show you a nice vacation photo and sometimes change a stat like weight.

Yes, the game has SO FREAKING MANY STATS. There's your physical stats like height, weight, bust/waist/hips, but also things like 3 different reputations (Housework, Fighting, Magic), various combat-related stats and things like Sin. The stats (and some in-game events) are what determines the ending that you get, and there's a whole spectrum of them. You can end up as a regular housewife. Or maybe you kill the Demon King and take over Hell. The "best" ending for the game is, BIG SURPRISE TO LIKE 3 PEOPLE, is becoming the Ruling Queen. The stats can also trigger certain events or prevent certain events from happening, such as a high stress level leading to sickness, truancy or running away from home for a month.

Princess Maker 2 doesn't have much in the way of "gameplay" outside of the adventuring part. Studying and working are done with a montague-like video that shows how your stats change, with a window describing whether you did well or just sat on your ass all day. And while it is possible to play the game without looking at the stats, it's going to be very difficult if you don't understand why your daughter keeps running away or why the butler insists she eats a lot every month. So if that's not the kind of game you fancy, Princess Maker 2 is shit. But if you're willing to experience it, Princess Maker 2 has a lot of funny, awkward, cute, happy and cool moments.

36048983.review:
There's a reason why a game from 1994 recieved updated graphics and a full voice over. Can you think of any other games from the 90s or early 2000s that do that? If you can, it's because they were insanely good games, well-loved and of high quality. That's what this game is, high quality --- it's visual novel-esque with heavy simulation aspects. This game has so much replayability that you can enjoy it over and over again, playing it through again right after you finish the first time.
You manage your child's life from around age 10 until adulthood, and shape the adult she becomes. I highly recommend this if you like sims of any kind, and you enjoy management style games. Even if you don't like visual novels, this is old school and a bit how original Japanese style VNs used to be back on the SNES, more like a game and less like a book. So give it a try!

34494961.review:
[h1]たぶん知っておいたほうがいいこと[/h1]

①アルバイトの成功条件として能力値が設定されている

たとえば料理屋は「料理」の能力が要求されるため、長期間働いて料理技能が十分に伸びるまで、失敗しつづける仕様になっている。
こういうのは問題ないのだが、たとえば髪結いの仕事だと、必要な「芸術」の能力は髪結いをしても成長しないので、いくら働いても金がもらえない奴隷労働と化す。
アルバイトにかぎらず、キーとなる能力値を知らないとどうしようもない場面がたくさんあるので、無理せず攻略情報を見ながら遊ぶのがいいと思う。それでも十分面白い。

②「自由行動」を月末に入れる

ストレスによるお邪魔イベントは月末に発生するので、月末にストレスを下げるようにスケジュールを組む。またストレスに対応するパラメータとして体力・信仰・モラルがあって、これらを上げた方がスムーズに遊べる。

③キャラメイクはまじめにやった方がいい

誕生日（守護星）によって初期パラメータが大幅に変わる。血液型はもっと重要で、A型だとストレスが毎月プラス2されるため、娘が笑わなくなる（これ本当にひどい）。


[h1]ここがつらい[/h1]

テキストの表示速度は変更できるがスキップ機能はないため、クリックを連打するはめになりダルい。吟味しないで遊んでもエンディングまで3時間はかかる。
あと表示速度をノーウェイトにするとアルバイトや習い事の結果が見れなくなるのが不便。エンディングまでカットされるから気をつけよう。
イベント数も豊富とはいえないので、8年という長期間で育成に作業感が出てくるのは正直否定できない。プレイヤーの妄想力が試される。
でもテキストじたいは淡白だから、おかずになりにくいんだよな。

[h1]ここがいい[/h1]

UIをふくめ、全体として完全な調和のとれた、美しいグラフィック。しかもボリュームがある。
娘のグラフィックが豊富なのは当然としても、モブキャラとか、背景とか、ちびキャラのアニメーションとか、細部にいたるまで実にリッチな作り。バブってるころの日本メーカーの凄みを感じられる。
あと赤井孝美のデザインは本当にきれいだと思う。コンピューターゲームに征服される以前の、古い和製西洋ファンタジーの格調の高さを体現している。
こういうファンタジーって現在のオタクカルチャーではほぼ絶滅した領域だし、輸出も少ないと思うので、海外レビュアーにえらい高評価なのはすごく納得がいく。
まるで一冊の絵本のような、あるいは宝石箱のような。うつくしいゲームだと思う。

Second most recent playthrough: I thought it would be funny partway through to make her a nun and have her marry the demon butler so I aimed for that ending. Result: She became a general and married a cheerful, sociable knight. And also she hated me for making her train all the time. 

Most recent playthrough: Burnt by my last experience, I decided to focus on making sure she won the Art Contest at the Harvest Festival for the cash. 14 year, probably due to all the dance lessons I'd been sending her on for stamina and glamour her rival was the Dance Party girl, to my displeasure as I had a sure winner with the Advent of Angels painting. But I went along with it because I didn't want my daughter to hate me. I made sure she smoozed with the Minister, I beggared myself buying her a dress, I sent her dance class after dance class. She ran away during the month of the next Harvest Festival. She had to fund her dance classes with hairdressing that year. Result: Became a dancer and married the demon butler which I wasn't even trying for. And she loved me for cherishing her. 

We make plans for our children and push them in that direction, but children will make their own choices and follow their own paths, parents plans for them be damned. That's why this game is an awesomely realisitic parenting simulator, apparent from all the fairy tea parties and demon feasts.

33710780.review:
Apesar das poucas horas que aparecerá registrado aqui no Steam, eu já perdi DEZENAS de horas jogando Princess Maker 2 na época em que surgiu a primeira edição traduzida em inglês, uma década atrás. Aproveitar o relançamento desta vez foi um mais para alimentar a melancolia, mas incrivelmente, mesmo depois de décadas, o jogo ainda estava tão fresco na minha memória que havia pouca coisa adicional que valesse a pena ser explorada de novo. 

Para quem já jogou a primeira e antiga versão, não há muita razão para adquirir o jogo, porque o conteúdo é o mesmo, arrisco dizer inclusive que com mais erros de tradução do que o original, e com alguns conteúdos "censurados" para agradar a sensibilidade exacerbada dos tempos atuais.

Para quem não conhece o jogo, contudo, é um prazo cheio dentro daquela categoria bem de nicho denominada de "life sim". Essencialmente você "interpreta" o pai de uma garotinha (fada na verdade) que lhe é presenteada pelos deuses com o objetivo (como o próprio nome diz)  de se transformar em uma princesa.

Para fazer isso o jogador precisa equilibrar a agenda de atividades da sua "filha" em períodos de lazer, estudo, e trabalho (na era medieval as restrições ao trabalho infantil não eram muito acentuadas). Cada atividade que é desenvolvida dentro da agenda aumenta (ou diminui) as estatísticas da personagem, sendo que essas estatísticas são essenciais para tudo, desde a chance de sucesso em determinadas atividades, até a quantidade de dinheiro ganho nos trabalhos desenvolvidos e, acima de tudo, para integrar uma equação final que dará o resultado do jogo: indicar o que aconteceu com sua filha depois que ela fez 18 anos. Claro qeu o objetivo é que ela se torne uma princesa, mas uma das graças do jogo é precisamente "encontrar" os diversos finais que as diversas combinações de estatíticas permitem, conferindo ao jogo um grau de "replayability" muito alto. 

Vale muito a pena dar uma chance, apesar da idade do jogo.

33318552.review:
I'm one of those people who have played PM2 when I was a still a kid and loved it. I always found it a shame that PM2 never was able to be released in the west officially so I was ecstatic to find out that a company (this being CFK) was going to localise all the Princess Maker Series with PM2 being the first to be released. Of course I am going to support it.
Playing it again (this time with the refined version in English) here's what I can say about this game:

Pros:

+First of all this game is addictive. It's easy to lose yourself in plotting your daughter's schedule and trying to guide her to whatever ending you're gunning for.
+This game has a high replay-ability value. PM2 has a lot of endings, A lot of events that a triggered based on what skills your daughter has, You wont be able to finish this game in a couple of playtroughs.
+Has endearing characters such Cube for example.
+Has an adventuring mode that gives the game more game-play and appeals to anyone who likes JRPG.
+Good Voice acting

Cons:
- The English release has awkward translations. Although CFK has made updates to improve them so this is not a major con but something to take note.
-Game has Risqué endings and events. This can be avoided in the game though if you are uncomfortable with them.

Overall, I would recommend this to anyone who love Sim games.

33261137.review:
I played the original version way back when, so how could I not play the official Steam release?

The good:
-Wide variety of endings & secrets. You'll be playing a while if you want to see everything!
-Nice artwork that's been updated a bit without losing its charm.
-Speed-up options. Particularly handy for speeding up the Harvest Festival(which is very long and repetitive).
-Voice acting! It's all in Japanese, but it's a nice touch for a re-release.

The bad:
-The translation is very hit or miss. Some things are phrased awkwardly, some characters get their names romanized differently in different places, and some things seem to be flat-out incorrect(the text after a win in the fighting tournament makes it sound like you lost, for instance).
-The work/training dialogue gets very repetitive after a while. It'd be nice to be able to disable it.

The neutral:
-No tutorial. I don't mind, and it's really not surprising since this is a game from the pre-handholding era, but be warned that the game expects you to figure everything out yourself. (Or read an outside guide)
-The bulk of the game is an endless statgrind/money management sim. I've played games like that before and enjoyed them, but it could come as a surprise to someone expecting a more traditional VN or RPG.

32491008.review:
Do you like lolitas from space/heavens? Do you like stat sims? Do you like Light RPG stuff? Do you like Mideaval times? Do you like anime? Then Princess Maker 2 Refined is for you. A TL;DR is at the bottom of the review. :)

Refined being the word they went with for "We updated the original title and put in some stuff and took out some other stuff to make it run smoothly"

This game was originally released on DOS a while back (if memory serves correctly) and it was a fun little title with a built-in cheat system that let you basically get a bunch of money (among other things that are a bit controversial and NSFW by today's standards) called Mad Eddy's. 


Mad Eddy's Cheats and Goods has sadly been removed and I hope it gets translated and re-added in a future patch or I will be very sad because it's nearly impossible to get these achievements without consulting a web guide if you want a specific ending. 

Aside from missing one of the elements that made the game a little easier for newcoming players this game holds up well in my eyes and is a lot of fun for a good few hours with high replayability with its total of over 50 different endings (I think). Some of the downsides I don't like that will hopefully find a fix soon are minor bugs such as the ending letter just sort of getting skipped if you prefer to play with voice acting turned off. Yes, they added voice acting. It's pretty good in my opinion, though I prefer to play the game without voice acting turned on because I liked the original where there wasn't any and personally the voices in my head fit the characters just a touch better. 

If you're a fan of the series you'll love this game and what it tries to do. If you're new to the series, it's a good start, but will probably be pretty confusing at first. 

One last thing to note: Some of the artwork contains NSFW 18+ Content as I've seen from community screenshots of other players' subsequent playthroughs and results so if you don't like nudity or something like that then maybe wait for a patch that censors it or something.

Final Verdict as of current state (6/16/17): 8/10
-Some of the missing elements make it more challenging than it was previously
-Some minor but fixable bugs keep it down
-Holds up extremely well
-Fun with lots of replayability 
-Really lovely artworks.

32019298.review:
I bought this game because the Internet told me it was similar to Long Live the Queen. The Internet was wrong.

This game lacks any narrative of Long Live the Queen, or more like, any narrative whatsoever. Random events occur often without any visible reason, story or meaning. Some skills may lead to your daughter running away or getting hit on by suitors. Without reading an actual walkthrough, you have no clue which skills cause this, even as it is happening. Nothing in this game is intuitive or exciting to discover. There is no clear goal to whatever you are doing. You can't even find the joy in your daughter succeeding, because it is impossible to relate to her in any way. There are a dozen or so different lines your daughter will say when you talk to her, many of them generic Japanese schoolgirl type lines such as "I wish my chest was bigger".

Were you to catch this game for a couple of euros/dollars/rupees, I would recommend it. It will offer you a few hours of clicking around and seeing what happens. However, if what you are looking for is a narrative and story based, intuitive goal-centered game, I cannot recommend you buy this game.

哲學家尼采曾經寫過一段名言：『白晝之光，豈知夜色之深。』，這句話的意思是指人的認知有限，無法理解不同領域的知識，亦無法理解他人的人生價值觀，對於還在幼年時期的筆者，有幸從父親那取得《Princess Maker 2》這款遊戲，當時的我對養兒育女完全沒有概念，所以對此部作品沒有太大興趣，直到近二十年後的現在，透過某股神秘力量驅使之下，我終於玩完了這被情懷所包裝的往事回憶。本作的故事大綱是在敘述生活安樂的人們過於貪婪，不再尊敬與祭祀眾神，憤怒的眾神命令來自地獄的魔王入侵人界，打算給予無知的人類教訓，身為勇者的你碰巧來到兩軍交會之處，不知原因如何，你奮不顧身地加入戰鬥，最後擊退魔王，讓人類得以繼續存活，來自天界的星座守護神看見你的事蹟，決定交付年僅十歲的女孩讓你照顧，她的命運完全掌握在你的手上，遊戲便正式開始。

《Princess Maker 2》精華之處在於，系統給予玩家八年時間，我們可以利用這段時間培育女兒，提升諸如魅力、智力、感性、體力等各項數值，這些數值的高低會直接決定女兒的結局，八年時限一到，遊戲便會蒐集各項數值，統計出不同的結局。舉例來說，假設你將女兒培育成戰鬥技術高超的武者，那麼可能會令女兒變成皇家騎士、道場館主、或是繼承父親事業成為勇者，智力較高的女兒會成為魔法師或史學作家，魅力指數高的女兒則有機會受到貴族青睞，接受皇室成員邀約，直接成為下一任皇后或是公主，順帶一提，想要玩父嫁結局的紳士們不用擔心，完成指定條件就能讓你嫁娶辛苦培育長大的女兒，追根究柢確實兩人沒有血緣關係，痛快的生一打活潑健壯的兒女根本不是問題，完全合法的！


培育女兒的方法總共分為兩種，一種是打工兼差，另一種是教育學習，由於遊戲剛開始取得的資金有限，大多玩家應該都跟筆者一樣，會先讓女兒前宿屋或是育幼院工作，藉由持續工作累積家務經驗並賺取些許金錢後，便可專注於一門課程培訓，等到訓練成果有起色，就能決定要將女兒塑造成怎樣的一名女性。當然，玩家也能在送女兒工作或上課之餘，讓她去城外進行武者修行（若不想讓女兒走戰鬥路線，可忽略此玩法），城外存在著許多危險敵人，建議事先將女兒的戰鬥技術提升至五十左右，且於武器店購買基礎武防具，準備齊全之後再出發，才不會讓女兒沒一會就被野怪秒殺，浪費時間又讓女兒無辜受傷。

每年固定舉辦的收獲祭是驗收教育成果的重要慶典，收穫祭共分為舞蹈大會、烹飪大會、藝術大會、格鬥大會四種賽程，每場大會所要求的能力數值都不盡相同，決定舞蹈大會能否獲勝的關鍵在於魅力，烹飪大會則是要與其他高手比較廚藝，藝術大會要求非比尋常的藝術才能，格鬥大會依賴女兒的戰鬥技術或魔法實力。從收穫祭得到優勝，不僅能得到高額獎金，更可取得獨一無二的特殊獎品，除此之外，外界給予女兒的評價也會水漲船高，戰鬥評價和魔法評價的提升會讓女兒在該領域更加強大，社交評價的提升則會給予女兒認識政商名流，甚至是與騎士、國王、王妃、王子等貴族結識，開啟皇后或公主的結局路線。


較為可惜的是，身為父親的玩家，鮮少有機會跟女兒互動，所謂的日常生活都被安排好的行程表佔據，不努力讓女兒成為某一方面的專長的話，資金不會有所提升，好吃懶做的勇者更不會自己出門工作，總是靠著國王施捨的五百金幣過活也不是辦法。雖說玩家可以安排十日假期跟女兒出門遊玩，實際上也沒有什麼地方好去，最多就是前往深山或是海邊，減輕壓力的同時，依照遊玩地點的不同，女兒會獲得不同的數值增減，例如前往深山欣賞花草樹木會提升女兒的感性數值，夏日時前往海邊，會降低女兒的體重，且還能夠讓膚色曬成健康小麥色（體重跟膚色的不同都會直接顯示在立繪上，細節處理滿分）。

『學到很多東西的訣竅，就是一下子不要學很多。』想要樣樣精通的結果，通常都是樣樣不精通，過少的自由時間會給予女兒過多的精神壓力，女兒會開始變得叛逆，叛逆期的女兒會心不在焉，工作偷懶就算了，就連上課也不會有任何成果，玩家僅能透過安排休假或給予零用金來安撫女兒情緒，希望她趕快改過自新，回到從前的乖寶寶形象。但相對地，假設太寵女兒，女兒會開始肆無忌憚的亂花錢，甚至還會隨意離家出走，或是接受中年怪叔叔的搭訕，成為對方私下包養的小三（沒有開玩笑，筆者的女兒一口答應成為中年大叔小三），所以要如何在嚴厲與放縱中進行取捨，取決於各位父親的教育方針是否正確。


《Princess Maker 2》雖然是款距今二十幾年的老作品，但仍不失其樂趣，所謂不被時代洪流沖淡價值的作品正是在指這類作品，被稱為【經典之作】一定存在不易取代的特色，就筆者個人而言，這部作品之所以會在我心中成為經典，絕對不是它滿足了人們對背德父嫁的渴望，更不可能是滿足一輩子不可能結婚之人的慾望。簡而言之：『喜愛孤獨者，非神即獸。』，人類都是懼怕孤獨的生物，一旦離開人群，沒有任何人可以保持理智生活下去，作品中登場的女兒是在當時少數可以跟玩家互動且能直接決定命運的女性角色，養死寵物雞的經驗相信大家或多或少都有，如果你養死的是作中的女兒，心中獲得的罪惡感絕對會比寵物雞的死去還深重，這正是為何本作是經典的主因，它會影響到你我心境。


優點：
+完成單輪遊戲約兩小時，包含五十種以上結局，全數達成要花不少時間。
+重玩價值極高，不看攻略遊玩會開啟意想不到的路線，獲得更多的驚喜。
+玩法設計方面多彩，教育、打工、修行、收穫祭，樣樣精通需要下足功夫。


缺點：
- 此版本為和諧過的全年齡向，許多福利內容如國王的新衣都被從作中移除。


結論：美少女夢工廠系列已經多年沒有新作，希望此經典系列能持續發展。

http://mgrim214.blogspot.com/2017/05/princess-maker-2.html

30485829.review:
2011 год, выпускной класс. Жизнь состоит из подготовки к выпускным, вступительным, сна, иногда еды, и ЕЁ. Скачанная с abandonware сайта игра, DOSBox - я играю украдкой в те часы, пока дома никого нет, чтобы добрые родственники не вздыхали, что "пора уже своих заводить, а она всё игрушки гоняет". Перевод игры неполный - в некоторых концовках просто нет текста, но никого это не пугает. Альтернативы всё равно нет.

2016 год, институт уже окончен. Princess Maker 2 в голове хранится, как тёплые воспоминания - и я уже приняла тот факт, что раз после 2007 года от Gainax про франшизу ни слуху ни духу, то они наверняка на неё забили. И в конце сентября муж интригующим голосом говорит, что у него для меня очень хорошая новость. Я захожу по ссылке на Steam. Слёзы, радость, чепчики в воздух.

Появление этой игры на западном рынке значит... очень многое. Серия Princess Maker выступила если не прародителем - были и более ранние примеры - то точно популяризатором жанра raising sim, и сейчас многие игры этого жанра стоят на том, что выстроила она. И точно также, как многие значимые игры, годы и годы она оставалась исключительно с закорючками - но хотя бы получила переводы на корейский с китайским, и приобрела своих фанатов и последователей не только в Японии. И именно это в конечном итоге и привело игру к релизу здесь - видимо, корейская компания CFK также решила "доколе?".

Не всё, конечно, прошло гладко. Но CFK сами признавали, что недоработки есть и приветствовали то, что им на них указывают, работая над своими ошибками. Я не знаю, в какой именно момент игра стала окончательно комфортно играбельной, но к концу февраля даже добавили ачивки. В сравнении с древним переводом под DOS версия от корейцев в чём-то даже точнее и лучше - и точно полнее.

Но в чём вообще суть? Если вы не в курсе, что такое raising sim, то Princess Maker 2 - это отличное место, чтобы познакомиться с жанром. Есть герой - обычный такой RPGшный герой. После определённых событий боги решают, что это отличная идея - дать суровому воину, который большую часть жизни резал мечом монстров, девочку на воспитание, не особенно спрашивая ни его, ни её. Проходит год и вот мы здесь - девочке десять лет, её надо кормить, одевать, воспитывать - готовить ко взрослой жизни и выводить в свет. Туториала нет - добро пожаловать в отцовство! 

Конечно, поможет демон-дворецкий, выделенный местным Сатаной в качестве компенсации за причинение инвалидности, но распоряжаться воспитанием придётся самому. Наращиваем/опускаем статы, любуемся на красивые анимешные иллюстрации и анимацию, бегаем по полю приключений, натыкаемся на ивенты, которых не просто много, а ОЧЕНЬ МНОГО. Игра невероятно богата на контент, а учитывая, что оригинальная дата её выхода - 1993 год, это заслуживает уважения.

Хотя, конечно, в Стиме появился не оригинал, а улучшенное переиздание 2004 года, но зачастую заставить работать даже игру такого типа под современные системы - это уже достижение.

Ещё плюсы:

+ Отсутствие цензуры! Не то что бы там было особенно что цензурить, но если вас, как и меня, раздражает аляписто накинутая "одежда", на которой разве что не открытым текстом написано "привет, я цензура!", то можно спокойно выдохнуть - здесь этого наконец-то нет. [spoiler]Главная претензия у меня всегда была к картинке летних каникул 12-13 лет, где Оливия спокойно себе загорает на пузе без одежды - SoftEgg накинули на неё криво нарисованное платье до колен, которое очень резко выделяется на фоне шикарной графики, и вообще в контексте "девочка загорает на пляже" смотрится просто... шта. Переплюнули их только корейцы, которые в нестимовской Refine версии обрядили её в вырвиглазное синее бикини со стрингами (!), которое даже ягодицы подчёркивало... зачем?[/spoiler]
+ Наконец-то можно пропустить вступительные титры! Для этого понадобилось всего лишь 23 года.
+ Больше не надо ломать глаза с мозгами об английскую систему мер - оригинальная метрическая красуется и в английской версии! [spoiler]Минус в том, что наконец-то осознаёшь, насколько нездоровые требования нужны для сохранения параметра "худая".[/spoiler]

tl;dr - покупайте. Извините за стены текста, но я люблю эту игру. И я счастлива видеть её здесь - видеть как действительно продукт и переиздание, а не попытку влёгкую срубить деньжат на ностальгии.

I planned on sending her to hard labor every day of her life from ages 10-18 and then see where things go from there. LIKELY a life as a sturdy brick shithouse nun if the gods would smile upon me. Optimistically, I did as I set out to do. I worked her every day for 3 months on a farm with no rest or leisure and at the age of 10 years 3 months she became a GANG MEMBER and would only wear a nightgown. 

At that point she didn't want to do anything anymore, just kept like, literally squatting and pissing at the farm or something like that, until she was arrested by soldiers that found her hanging out with theives. I noticed she was gaining a lot of strength but still was beefy so I cut her diet down to the strictest level possible. This broad could still bale hay, let me tell you. I was pretty pissed off that she was so pathetic so I sent her back to the farm, but they kicked her out for having a bad attitude.

It soon became winter and she was sick and cold because she only had a summer dress. FINE. I spent almost all our savings to buy her some mail armor to go over the dress to keep her warm. 29362872.review:
I played both the original and refine versions of this game, and I can firmly say that the refine version lives up to my expectations perfectly. I do have some problems with this release, however.

First of all, the achievement system is bugged to a small degree. Achievements do pop up where they should, but are not implemented correctly, making a few of them incredibly easy to get. It's not a huge bother and makes it easier to earn all of them. Second, the font used for text is very off-putting and does not match up well with everything else in the game. they should've used the original font from the old beta, as it would've matched up much better and made the game easier to read.

My biggest problem with this release is the translation, which I assume was done by amateur translators. There are many misspellings and grammatical errors, which makes the job seem unprofessional. They also changed a lot of the names of the stats, which will confuse veteran players of the series if they don't have the names memorized. There are also some cases where things are translated completely wrong, which can confuse both new and veteran players. Overall, the translation is just shoddy and they should've hired a better translator.

Does this mean I don't like it? Of course not. The core mechanics of the game are still perfectly intact and the art of the characters and locations has been flawlessly remastered to fit modern day expectations of the gaming industry. It is not a perfect game, but that doesn't mean it is a bad game. I believe if the developers work on the translaton and achievement mechanics more, this can become a crown jewel of a game.

Overall, I do reccommend new and old players of the series pick this game up, it is definitely worth your money. I give it a final rating of 9/10. I would give it a perfect score had the translation and achievement system not been butchered.

29199778.review:
I wanted to arrange marriage between my daughter and Demon Lord and because of my actions, she end up being a pro stitute (Steam censor, sorry!). But hey! She did married a Demon Lord anyway so... I won... I guess? ^^"

I always wanted to play "Princess Maker 2", but couldn't get it to work on my PC, so you can imagine, how happy I was, when I saw it on Steam. The reputation that "Princess Maker 2" has is well deserved. This is a very good game, easily the best "raise your kid" simulator currently available on Steam (it even beats "Long Live The Queen", which I also enjoy a lot), but at the same time, it is so much more. 

It has interesting bits of story and lore, thrown here and there. This is a very complicated game, with a lot of aspects - you will shape relationship with your daughter, you will send her to classes, so that she can learn new skills, but that costs money. So you will have to send her to work (sometimes to not nice places) or send her to go on adventures. There are many different skills, characters, hidden statistics and all sorts of stuff, that will impact how your daughter will end up. There are over 70 (!) different endings, plus few different marriage options [spoiler]Cube is my favorite so far ♥[/spoiler]. Also, you need to be aware of your daughters morality and stress level - she may be ill, she may become a delinquent, she may run from home, she may even die. Watch over her diet too. Oh, and don't be surprised, when she will fall in love or become someone's mistress. There are lots and lots of very subtle changes and many strategies to raise your daughter. 

This game has huge replayability - I've played it three times already and I will definitely come back for more, as I want to see all of the most interesting endings and get all achievements. If you haven't play this game, give it a shot - it's lovely, it has a lot of secrets and it's very interesting to see results of your choices. I fully recommend it.

29195950.review:
I never cried, then I bought this game. Its a nice change of pace from the constant war and death in video games. Dont get me wrong thats all fun too, but its nice to get something peaceful and happy. In the game you are a great hero who saves a nation from certain doom, and as a reward heaven grants you a 10 year old girl from heaven to raise as a daughter. Its a strange reward to be sure but ok. You choose her birthday, her name, your name, your birthday and your age and the game begins. She has a ton of different stats, which get higher or lower depending on what you have her do. having her work at a farm will increase strength and stamina but will lower elegance. Doing housework helps her learn cooking and cleaning but she makes no money. There are other jobs such as lumber jack, babysitter, prostitute. That last one is real, and it pays a ton of money, but no daughter of mine will be caught in a place like that so off she went to the lumber mill. She was as graceful as a giraffe on roller blades but she could break you in half if she wanted to, and she was only 13 at the time. Outside of work she can study, which you spend money on rather than earn it. This affects more active stats like combat skill, decore, manners, intelligence and so on. You need to balance studies wil work and also which ones you select depending on what you want her to be. For instance its a good idea for her to practice Kung-FU and be a lumber jack because they complament each other, while dancing classes and lumberjack cancel out and leave you with a ton ofwasted money and nothing to show for it. When I first palyed I wanted to go with a princess Zelda type, very smart, good sword fighter, magical, and a princess. the problem was all those lessons cost more that you will have most of the time so I ended up sticking her in a resturant where she made bank and taught her manners so she would be noticed by the royalty. I also wanted her to be intelligent so I also gave her science classes. She ended up becoming aa housewife, and a damn good one at that. AAlthough she didnt marry a prince, she did marry a rich man, so I was satisfied know my son in law would eaty well the rest of his natural life as he married the official best cook in the nation 6 years in a row. 

My second runthrough I wanted my daughter to take my place as legendary hero, so I got her to work the farm and do Kung-fu. Long story short, she defeated the God of War when she was 15 and eventually became grand general of the royal army. She married well and I shed actual tears. 

Good game 10/10

29076100.review:
Ah Parenthood, what could be more precious a gift than your own tender offspring to raise, cherish and nurture into helpful members of society...

This game however shows just how awful a parent you can truly be without needing to be brought before social services like the effing monster you are! 

After seeing screenshots of this game for about ten years or so my curiosity had been piqued, after all if I could raise a stable of proud racing Chocobos and adorable little Chaos then an actual Dad Simulator RPG wih a human larva should have been a fun new challenge and, after PeanutButterGamer's review made me aware of this games Steamification (it's a legitimate phrase as of now!), I decided to shell out on the reduced price tag and purchase me Princess Maker 2.

The story is simple, the Kingdom of Bleh has pis*ed off the gods so they send the demon king to generally bugger things up but then enter our hero! (you, ya fool) After being badly injured you acquire a demon butler, a miniscule pension and a hearty handshake from the King. one day you are drawn inexplicably to a mountain and promptly have an Astrosprog foisted upon you by a god. Like any sensible person suddenly endowed with a ten-year old cosmic starchild that came out of a ball of light you comply and have eight years to properly raise your new daughter.

The gameplay is pretty simple, you get three blocks of time in a schedule for your daughters time. Each month you must raise money (through conveniently lax medieval child labour laws), send her off to be tutored and level up her stats, and ensure she is healthy and happy. You may also, if you wish, send her off adventuring to loot ancient temples and fight monsters for pocket change and sometimes a nice bit of treasure which also boosts her stats. Prior to deciding upon her schedule you may talk to her, buy things for her for those all-important stat boosts and introduce her to them high-society nobs living in the palace, just make sure you upgrade her manners stat before letting her go near certain people.

So, how did my first playthrough pan out? Awfully, I ended up bakrupt twice and failed. However once I learned of the Kung-Fu Farmer technique I soon had a teenage badass war-wench raking in the money and kills in a way that wouldn't be out of place in Slayers. So the day of her 18th birhtday came and it was time for daddy's little starsprog to go out into the world and forge her own path in life! Then I found out she utterly sucked at doing paperwork so they refused to let he rinto the army, she established a dojo but had no social skills so she ended up failing as an instructor, she did get married though and I didn't pi*s the gods off by her becoming a delinquent dominatrix (yes... that can happen... don't ask why just try and avoid it...) so, in general, I pretty much didn't screw up entirely.

To summarise my experience with Princess Maker 2 short of it being about royals shagging it's exactly what you'd expect from the title short of it being called "Dad Simulator RPG", if you like the training/tuition/raising aspect of games like Monster Rancher and Digimon World or just have to check it out due to sheer curiosity and a quick laugh I'd wholeheartedly reccomend it. It's a very, very odd duck but i'd say it's worth checking out if you like RPGs or management sims and want something unique. and if Uncle Gabe has put it on sale even better!

28969026.review:
条件：气质800，道德500（非必须，但是没有达成的话最后还是由王子当国王），战斗评价440，魔法评价430，社交420，家事420
结婚：王子结婚：每年1月见青年武官
龙族结婚：西方沙漠击败之，魅力300时见老龙，几月后求婚，答应
父亲结婚：本结局不能
管家结婚：不能
以上条件不满足就是无名氏婚姻
女王工作与学习过的地方：家政，农场，酒店，教会；剑术，格斗，礼仪，绘画，神学，魔法
参考数值：
体力400
腕力300
智力300
气质900（最重要）
魅力500
道德400（达到500不易）
信仰800
罪孽0
感受500
疲劳0
战斗评价或魔法评价过高时，拒绝挑战，一次减15，以此平衡
社交=礼仪100+艺术100+谈话100=300；舞蹈冠军加40，3届，40X3=120，条件达成420（不含奖励值）
家事=烹饪100+扫除100+待人100=300；烹饪冠军加40，3届，40X3=120，条件达成420（不含奖励值）
攻略流程：
设定：生日10月1日，血型O（各方素质加高）或者A(后期涨道德)
第1年，10月至2月尽量多安排家政，每个月给零花钱降疲劳以多安排两次家政。2月结束的时候保证烹饪上60，不够就S/L. 烹饪60以后只要疲劳不要太高餐厅打工就可以完美完成了，在餐厅打工保证钱的前提下，尽量多安排去山上度假增加感受。9月份上山度假增加感受最高，所以尽量安排9月三次山上度假。到收获季烹饪肯定满了，感受只要在120以上就机会获得总冠军（但优势不大，需要S/L多试几次）。胜利后不吃蛋涨100感受，保证今后两年的烹饪总冠军。钱超过1000,5000时,商人来访，三次都买恶魔首饰。
第2年和第3年，练剑术直到攻击满，然后练格斗直到战技满。没钱就去农场打工。收获季依然是烹饪，选择吃蛋涨体力。
第4年，先去北方武者修行，拿东方片刃剑。再依次去东方，南方和北方把三个通缉犯抓了（记得把宝箱也搜刮了）。去墓地打一次工打赢亡灵骑士（不一定会出记得S/L）。这样就攒了一大笔钞票了。狂学魔法直到满（但是千万不要去学加智力），然后去西方武者修行把三个恶魔项链都给恶魔，气质和魅力暴涨300点。在恶魔洞口扎营睡一晚选择涨气质。这一代的地狱鸟和骷髅兵打死以后都掉很多钱，没钱就来这刷，运气好能挣四五千。彻底摆脱穷鬼时代。收获季参加武斗大赛。
第5年，酒店打工直到谈话满。然后恶补自然科学直到智力300。然后练舞蹈。收获季参加武斗大赛并且要以魔法取胜。
第6年，学一次绘画然后狂上舞蹈直到艺术满。由于魅力高，艺术满以后随便买件最便宜的丝衣就可以舞蹈冠军了。然后上礼仪开始冲最难的气质。每个月顺便去王宫聊聊天涨人际关系。收获季舞蹈比赛。
第7年，差不多一整年都去学礼仪了直到气质800.收获季继续舞蹈大赛。
第8年，气质800以后全力去教堂打工尽可能多的增加道德。如果战斗评价和魔法评价不够或太高，就反复上街直到有人挑战。打赢可以加评价，拒绝就降评价（现在的水平要打输也不可能）。

成就最难解的应该是嫁给魔王，在N次失败后，查阅了不少资料，终于搞定了，需要这么几个条件：
1、魅力>300，气质>200，罪孽>道德的两倍；
2、触发过魔王的酒宴事件（信仰<20时露营在魔王家门口）；
3、触发过魔王给属性事件（信仰≥20时露营在魔王家门口）。

很多攻略只写了要满足1、2条件，但是没有写还有跟2相反的第3个条件。
最后，祝你们也都成功解锁！

28924099.review:
I've played and loved this game since I was very young, and I was excited beyond belief when I saw it was being rereleased on Steam. I played the original DOSbox PM2 English fan translation endlessly as a child.

However, I am disappointed in some of the directions taken with the "refined" game. For one thing, the translation is notably worse - several grammatical errors caught my eye in just a few minutes of gameplay, especially in the opening sequence.

For another, there are several scenes missing throughout the game, for example you (the swordsman) being gifted Cube the butler.

Finally, and this is by far my biggest gripe with the refine, the art. Simply put, no excuses can be made for replacing charming (if dated) sprites, especially those of your daughter that the player will be viewing for 90% of gameplay, with cheap MSPaint-tier knockoffs. They are simply ugly to look at, and very out of place with the original backgrounds.

I will play and likely enjoy PM2R, but I cannot in good faith recommend it to others looking for what I was, which is Princess Maker 2 but a bit shined off and with reliably working audio.

4/10

(Also, I'm a bit disappointed that the cheat menus were not ported as well. It just isn't the same without infinite money!)

27537333.review:
Plan your daughter’s day simulator. 

You choose what classes your daughter take, what jobs she does, and work to raise her stats. You have some other mini- games such as a simplified battle system you see when wandering the wilderness and there are set events that happen every playthrough. As a game it can be boring if you don’t enjoy stat raising as a main mechanic. 
The biggest positive to this game is making your own story as you play. Do you raise a saint, a warrior, a housewife?  Crafting your own story is where the fun is at and I find the game enjobable because of it. There is replay value in raising the character a different way, focusing on combat skills, domestic skills, and others.

Negatives
There are many problems with the translation. There have not been instances that I couldn’t understand what it meant but it sounds very off. Nothing game breaking but still noteworthy.
The end text for me at least scrolled too fast and I couldn’t see much though I think that got patched after my playthrough.  
It’s an old game and it feels old. That said if you don’t mind that it is still a fun game. 
The above-mentioned focus on raising stats may not be enjoyable for many

Conclusion. 
I do like this game and think that people should give it a try as it is something different and has plenty of replay value with plenty of endings.  Grab it on sale and give it a go if you are unsure. Watch a video and see if it interests you. I enjoy and recommend it.

27436948.review:
[i]Princess Maker 2 Refine[/i] es la primera versión comercial que llega a Occidente. Dicho juego consiste en criar a una niña, tu hija, hasta llegar a la madurez. En este tiempo, tendrás que enseñar habilidades (sociales, de combate o domésticas) y mejorar sus atributos. 

Aunque se le clasifica como un [i]Life Simulation Game[/i] —o LSG—, combina elementos de este género con los del RPG. En las fases de juego de rol, tu hija debe compeltar una serie de objetivos en un mapa, aunque no será fácil porque luchará contra enemigos. A diferencia de otros juegos parecidos, como [i]Long Live the Queen[/i], y otros afines, como [i]Tokimeki Memorial[/i], [i]Dōkyūsei[/i] o [i]Shin Seiki Evangelion: Ayanami Ikusei Keikaku[/i]; este juego es mucho más completo y variado. Esto lo demuestra el hilo argumental del juegos y sus más de 70 posibles finales. 

Los gráficos están actualizados y son más claros. Esta versión permite apreciar los diseños e ilustraciones de Takami Akai, aunque este viejo carcamal prefiere los antiguos gráficos de PC98. En cuanto a la música, la banda sonara de Masahiro Kajihara está remasterizada y sus notas más claras que la versión para MS-DOS en una SoundBlaster 16 (y ofrece también la elección la música en formato MIDI). No obstante, la mejor banda sonora pertenece a la conversión para PC-Engine. Además, este [i]remake[/i] incorpora voces en japonés ausentes en las versiones para ordenador, pero sí en PC-Engine o en PlayStation 2.

Para concluir este análisis, Princess Maker 2 es una pieza importante para entender la cultura contemporánea japonesa por dos motivos. Por un lado, la desarrolladora del juego, Gainax, creó las bases para el LSG japonés. Por otro lado, es de los primeros videojuegos comerciales multiplataformas en los que aparece la estética [i]kawaii[/i] y [i]loli[/i], tan popular entre los aficionados japoneses de hoy.

Если коротко - вам предстоит выступить в роли отца, который отправляет вашу дочь на лесопилку из года в год. 
Если более детально: игра с гигантскими масштабами, куча секретов (попробуйте поспать в четверг возле пещеры демонов. Вас удивит результат). Убейте бога войны. Убейте всех. Или нихрена не делайте и работайте на лесопилке. В совершеннолетие ваша дочурка чирканет вам элегантное письмо, в котором в подробностях распишет вам, как ей сладко жилось.

Так, а теперь для тех, кто не в курсе. У вас есть дочь. Ее надо воспитать. Как - зависит от вас. Она может стать продажной жрицей любви или же принцессой. 26105207.review:
I've been familiar with Princess Maker 2, mostly due to a Hardcore Gaming 101 article on the saga of this game's near localization back in the nineties. Being a fan of sim games and visual novels. this appealed to me. Then word came that PM2 was coming to Steam. As a port of the redone PS2 release. Well. I promptly bought it. 

Story wise, it's pretty simple. At some point, the kingdom the game takes place in got too prideful and full of themselves, so God sent the Demon King and his army after them. A young hero from the east, hearing about the people's plight, takes on the Demon King in battle, and wins. Graciously accepting his defeat, the Demon King leaves, later sending one of his warriors, Cube to serve as your butler. For what it's worth, this tidbit is never mentioned in game, only in extra materials. Anyway, at some point afterwards, Heaven sends you a little girl to raise. You shape her personality through jobs, classes, and errantry. Money WILL be tight, as you only get 500 gold a year, and your little girl helps with her earnings. 

For those who like getting Achievements, this game is a tad wonky when it comes to receiving certain ones.  There's also the translation, which is still a bit off. The developers are working on this, though. The PM community is passionate about these games, and they are considering releasing the others here on Steam (Yay!).

What will your daughter grow up to be? Will she survive to adulthood? Will she marry the Prince? A dragon? Your butler? Will her heavenly guardian chew you out for being a bad parent? There's twenty different endings, some of which overlap in a way.

26049367.review:
個人的にはシリーズ最高傑作！そして全ての育成ゲームの中でも１，２を争うほど面白いです。
Refine版の声優さんは西村ちなみさんのようですが、
PCEやセガ版の久川綾さん、FMTOWNSの笠原弘子さん版も味があってオススメなので
これを機に中古ショップをあさることをお勧めします。レッツコンプリート！私は久川さんが好きです。

ゲームの流れは、オーソドックスな育成ゲームでRPG要素もあり。
天界の娘を義父として育てるゲームなのですが
いい子に育てたり、色んな意味で悪い子に育ったりと
８年後の能力値やそれまでのプレイ内容でエンディング（最終的に就く職業）がマルチに変化します。
最近のゲームでは考えられないくらい細かい条件で変わるので、かなりリプレイ性は高いです。

BGMもいいですね。特に夏のBGMが好きでずっと聞いていられます。

初プレイ時は小学生だったのですが、最初につける名前に真剣に２時間ほど悩み、
当時声優さんについて詳しくなかったにも関わらず偶然「綾」というまともな名前を付けた私は
間違いなく将来結婚して子供が生まれてもキラキラネームはつけません。
安心して私と結婚して下さい。
あの頃から父性というか保護欲のようなものが芽生え、
ロリキャラに対して萌えるよりもきちんとした大人としての目線を持つことが出来たので、
お子さんが将来ロリコンにならないための父性を育むゲームとしてもおすすめです。
王子にすらコイツどこの馬の骨やねん、うちの娘をやるかボケという気持ちを抱くことができます。
ただコスチュームチェンジの時に裏技で裸にできたり、
主人公である自分との結婚ルートもあるような気もしますが、そんなことは忘れました。
ダメな感じに育てると、将来割とリアルな職業に就くので幸せな将来を送ってもらう為にも
真摯に向き合い、子の幸せを一番に考えた育成をしましょう。

なのでみなさんも、実際に子育てする時はプリメ感覚で真剣に育てましょうね。男は知らん。

26005851.review:
I bought this game out of nostalgia. I don't really regret it either. I love Princess Maker 2. However, there are a few things that I definitely think can be improved upon:

1) In the orginal DOS game at the end of the game you get a letter from your daughter. She tells you her favorite subjects, what she remembers doing the most, etc. Instead, in Princess Maker 2: Refine, it shows a picture of your daughter, has her speaking in Japanese and absolutely no translation which is honestly super disappointing. (Disregard, I see they did an update last night that should have fixed this issue. I'll have to play through and see how it is!)

2) I wish the menu/interface were a little less clunky? I had the speech setting sped up to 'fast', and I got to the ending where my "daughter" became a mistress (oops). I was unable to change the text speed to read the conversation between her, Cube, and the man proposing to "my daughter". It kind of detracted from the ending since the speech went too fast and I was unable to change it back.

3) I think the translation needs a bit of work, and I saw in the recent updates that they have addressed that issue. In the original DOS game your "daughter" has a "Sin" stat bar, in Princess Maker 2 : Refine it's called Karma. It took me 2 play throughs to see that getting Karma up was not a good thing. This is due to the fact that I didn't think hunting would increase sin, and my first play through ended up with a thug ending because her sin was pretty high. I really hope to see an update with sentences and such fixed. I am not sure what it is supposed to mean when you lecture your daughter and she responds with "but she was not satisified".

Overall, I love this game. I'll keep playng until I get all 74 endings, I'll do all the marriages and I'll enjoy myself. I think I would recommend this to anyone who hasn't played it in their childhood, but is still interested in raising sims. With 74 endings, and so many different things you can do I don't know how you can't be entertained. I am really hoping the sales of this game will inspire them to translate and bring over Princess Maker 3, 4 and especially 5.

25957312.review:
[b]pros:[/b] Cute stat raising sim with a shocking wealth of content, especially if you enjoyed the beta version as a youth. New art, new music, new translation, [b]full voice acting![/b]
[b]cons:[/b] Got some creepy stuff in it which they made no attempt to remove. This translation is a bit ramshackle. No fast forward button that I'm aware of.

My narrative is the same as a lot of people: got the unfinished DOS version as a child, played it extensively, rediscovered it later. It's a very cute game that I think ended up having a large female fanbase on accident, kind of like Harvest Moon. I hold it very close to my heart and would recommend it to anyone with even a passing interest in this kind of game because I think it's one of the best raising sims out there, but it's not without its flaws.

[b]The story goes as follows:[/b] you're a wandering swordsman, you save a kingdom from demons, God rewards you with a child. You get to raise her however you want, but you don't have a lot of money.

Each month is divided into 3 segments. For each of these, you can either:
[b]Send her to work[/b] - babysitting, church volunteer, farmwork, etc. more jobs unlock as you get older (raises stats, lowers others, gives money)
[b]Send her to school[/b] - dance lessons, Science, etc. (only raises stats, but takes money)
[b]Send her adventuring[/b], a sort of RPG overworld minigame (Yes, you can send your 10 year old into a frozen tundra with no weapons or armor if you really want to)
[b]Give her some free time[/b] (Work and school will both accumulate stress that needs to be relieved or she will fall ill)

Throughout your play, your daughter's stats will gradually shape into something that determines the final ending she gets. Will she become a member of the nobility? A child of the arts? A great warrior? Or something more sinister?

The game's most prominent feature, I think, is its replayability. [b]Notably, there are 74 endings[/b], and several possible marriages on top of that. Something as simple as your daughter's birthday and blood type might result in a different starting layout for your stats. There are a lot of hidden secrets, and you might find some of the stats have surprising uses (or consequences).

You can play the game in a lot of different ways and the game doesn't penalize you for it - maybe you want to be a magical girl and adventure every other week, paying your way through Theology and Magic classes with loot, or maybe you never want to touch adventuring and work her way through Poetry classes by working at a hair salon. Neither of these are wrong ways to play!

[b]Now, for the bad:[/b]

[b]This translation, as others have stated, is not as coherent as the original beta one[/b]. Fortunately and unfortunately, it's the worst at the start of the game and the end of the game, meaning that for the most part the translation is very serviceable, but you get dialogue like [spoiler]"From there, it would seem she made an excellent turn."[/spoiler] during your ending. Uh, what? I only knew it meant [spoiler]"Your daughter was excellent at her job."[/spoiler] thanks to having played the original.

However, the localization team seems to be responsive to complaints and committed to making edits to fix the game, including (supposedly, I haven't tested) fixing several broken achievements and adding subtitles to the voiceover-only ending after enough people complained, and there's a suggestion thread in the forums for finding typos or localization errors.

Also, for those of you hoping they removed the creepier parts of this game: [b]Nope.[/b] You can still:

1. [spoiler]MARRY YOUR DAUGHTER (it's not incest if it's not blood related, apparently!)[/spoiler], something that from the lack of an achievement for it I'd hoped they had removed for the Steam release
2. see your underage daughter naked in several vacation CGs, even if the beta version made attempts to remove this
3. hear your daughter talk to her FATHER about how she wishes her chest was bigger (please stop, oh my God)
4. buy pills that increase chest size from a shady salesman

These are gross and I wish they'd been removed. Unlike something like the shadier venues you can work at when you get older which you can argue serve a gameplay purpose, increasing your 12 year old's bust size serves no real purpose except being [i]extremely creepy![/i]

In summation, [b]if you love this kind of game or played it as a kid and are willing to overlook creepiness and translation errors, get it,[/b] it's a hidden gem with a lot of heart and seems to have a good team behind it. [b]If you think you'd enjoy it but you're not sure you want to spend $20 on it, wait for a sale[/b] or perhaps try the DOS version first to see if it's the kind of game you like before coming back to buy it.

25936328.review:
You play the part of a hero that was granted a child by the gods. A pure, innocent little girl who has been sheltered from the world in ways only the gods can shelter. Or at least, only the gods could get away with such treatment of a child. It comes across as being similar to keeping a newborn in the basement for the first ten years of her life, only interacting with her on a basic level and not allowing any contact with the world outside. Someone call heavenly child services! 

You have to raise her from that tender age of ten, arranging for everything from her diet, to her clothes, to her education. Raising a child and giving her a good education isn't cheap, either. How can a single adoptive father, on a stipend from the kindgom of a meager 500 gold per year, afford it? On a normal diet, the girl eats 360 gold per year, and the other 140 isn't nearly enough for all the little things a child needs, or anything resembling an education. Well, the answer is obvious. Put her to work! 

From the age of 10, your adoptive daughter can do work as a babysitter, watching over other children barely any younger than her and keeping them out of trouble. Or she could work on a farm, buiding up her strength and destroying her appearance. Or, for a penny a day, she could work at the church... she'll even get sundays off! Wait... what? 

Doing jobs and taking classes will raise some of the girl's stats and lower others, and the fun of the game is all the different ways your daughter can turn out. A dancer! A painter! A poet! She can become loved by high society, and leave her mark on the world through her arts. Or... an Archmage! A Hero! She can learn to wield might and magic, and even challenge the very god of war in her adventures! Or... A hunter! A... concubine? The [i]demon queen[/i]?!?!  You can hopelessly corrupt your child, and offend the gods with how bad of a father you have been.

The game is an interesting take on the life simulation genre, and offers dozens of endings for great replayability. Highly recommended for those that like stat management/micro management games.

Compared to the old version, it runs smoother and looks nicer. Runs in fullscreen (which the screenshots don't show, it works with widescreen resolutions and looks good)
However, the translation isn't as good.
The big difference though is that this version is uncensored, there's nudity where there wasn't in the old one. 
The game is almost perfect for kids, and the updates are mostly making the game better for that. The nudity and sexual comments and innuendo being more direct now, take away all that.
Hopefully when the other games in the series get translated they're more kid friendly. As if it wasn't for the gross 'fanservice' they'd be the perfect game for kids. 
Beyond localisation there seemed to be only a couple minor bugs and some achievements not being counted. But nothing gamebreaking.

Past comparisons, PM2 is a fun game. Time management with a good story and a fun RPG minigame, where you can strike down the God of War. While theoretically you're playing an offscreen adoptive parent, really you're playing a demigod girl sent to live among the mortals and managing your education till the age of 18 when you find out how things turn out.
It's a bit old fashioned in its morals. Marriage and child raising are held above career achievements in measuring success. But thats a small thing, its a game where you can rise to being anything from the Queen, mercenary wizard to the ruler of hell. You can marry a Dragon too, oh also a Prince.

25834324.review:
Just played my first playthrough. I must say... I really enjoyed it! I've never experienced this type of game before so it felt a bit strange. I would recommend this game to anyone that doesn't mind the old style anime appeal and a text based adventure that you play a part in. My ony major complaint is that at the end of teh game, the Daughter says how she felt in Japanese with no translation! I even used a translation app to try and get the gist of what she was talking about, but it couldn't hear her clear enough. Also, I'm not sure if this is a glitch or whatever, but my Daughter, kept failing doing the Inn job, even though I spammed it until I reached max cooking. As everyone mentions, the translation can be bad, but I haven't found it to be distracting at all. But in spite of the downsides, I really loved this game! The girl, seeing her age from 10 to 18 really pulls at your heartstrings and makes you feel like you bonded and raised this (hopefully) great girl thats now a woman. I felt proud knowing that my little girl turned into a noble soldier.

So in short:
Pros
Fantastic music
Engaging classic RPG fighting/adventure
Many Endings
Diverse ways to play
Truly endearing
Pacing feels great (8 years to see things unfold)

Cons:
Certain Stats feel a less useful (ie temperment)
Translation (Average player shouldn't be too annoyed)
Daughter's Life Summary words not subtitled (God this is the worst! Please fix)

Wishes:
More clothing would have been awsome. /thnking about all the playthroughs I could do, seeing the few thats present is kind of dissappointing. The could even have the same stats as clothing already present.Think of them as "alternative" outfits.
An "Ending Vault" so that I can view the Daughter's Life Summary after I unlock it. This would be cool, as the player would feel like even like their Daughter is gone but not forgotten.
The other Princess Makers! I saw that Princess Maker 5 was created in Japan. I'm thankful for this one we have, but I would expect Princess Maker 5 to be even more incredible. I would even be happy if we got 3 and 4 first within quick succession.

I hope my horrible review helps someone decide if this game is worth their time. If you enjoy life simulation, I think this "schedule" style simulation is a good approach. It really makes you feel like you're raising a Daughter in an anime styled world. I imagine the playthroughs feel uniquely different as you don't have time to make some "god" character. Can't wait for tomorrow since I will be making my second Daughter! 

If the Developer's see this review. Please fix that subtitle problem! I felt so disconennected from my Daughter at that time. It was almost sadder then knowing she has grown up and left her Father...

5 Stars *****

25832741.review:
[h1]Princess Maker 2 combines three of my favorite things: pet-raising simulators, dozens of endings, and playing matchmaker.[/h1]

Unlike a Tamagotchi, your daughter (probably) isn't going to end up dead in a room full of nothing but poop. I can't confirm since I haven't gotten all 70ish endings, but she's a lot more likely to grow up to be the queen of all poops. Or a dancer, which might be worse--I didn't spend [i]eight years[/i] and tens of thousands of gold on a top-notch education just for you to become a [i]dancer,[/i] sweetie.

Now you, too, have the opportunity to probably be a terrible parent without risking permanent damage to your delicate lady parts or 18 years' worth of child support payments. In real life, careless parenting is pretty much limited to leaving your child unattended for hours in the nearest Walmart. In Princess Maker 2, your precious daughter can literally marry Satan when she grows up. Next time, don't let her work at the cabaret and partake in underage drinking, Dad.

You're (probably) not going to hell after playing this game, despite the old DOS version’s greatly exaggerated reputation. And if you do, at least you have a shot at marrying the supreme ruler of Hell--if your poorly raised daughter hasn't married him first. The only thing removed from the original game is the cheat/debug mode, so you have to actually raise your child and force her to work or explore and fight in the RPG sections if you want a steady supply of cash.

As I pushed my daughter to the brink of exhaustion and forced her to work on the farm for weeks at a time, I realized I didn’t care enough about her dreams and feelings. I cared about [i]results[/i]: getting her the best marriage partner, raising her to be the strongest combatant in the realm…okay, and the actual game achievements. Right now, some of them are kind of buggy, but they’re all legitimately attainable. I assume they’ll be fixed in a later patch.

As others have mentioned, the current translation is a bit rough around the edges and your daughter’s speech at the end of the game desperately needs subtitles—unless you’re fluent in Japanese. I am glad for the added voice acting, though it can get repetitive after a while. Setting the text to instant (or “Without wait,” as the odd translation puts it) helps a lot if you’re speeding through to get different achievements and endings. It’s a shame the Steam overlay doesn’t work, but it might be unavoidable considering the age of the game.

Despite the minor issues I have with PM2, I’d love to see Princess Makers 3-5 on Steam someday, so I can continue to accidentally torment my innocent blank slate of a child as I try to shape her into what I failed to become in my own life. But as [strike]I[/strike] they say, it's never too late to become a queen of darkness.

25797520.review:
Alright so, this port isn't quite as good as the original DOS version. The graphics while better aren't as charming, the music is a bit buggy and the translation has weird moments ("Your daughter has been defeated by" being your victory screen for example) but at the same time, its just as fun as the original game. I wouldn't go as far and say the port is terrible, but take it as a warning. 

Now onto the actual game. Its great. You ever play Long Live The Queen? They're fairly similar games. The main difference being that Long Live The Queen being more focused on political and militaristic aspect of castle life, this game is more of a general life simulator set in a castle. You can do so much with raising your daughter, its pretty insane how much content their is in that regard. You can train her to be a soldier, a priestess, a teacher, a dancer, a singer, an artist, a witch, any blend of those and so much more. The game has over 40 endings too!

The game also has a combat system and dungeon exploration if you chose a more offensive route. They're extremely simple, but they get the job done and are pretty rewarding. I do wish the dungeon exploration had more to it, but its still fun for what it is. On another note, the soundtrack of the game is pretty underrated. While its not the best, the tunes in the game are very relaxing and make me feel at ease. 

This game isn't without its flaws however. My biggest gripe is that your daughter can get extremely overpowered relatively early in the game. I'm only in Year 2 (out of 8) and I'm already one-shotting dragons and winning the Harvest Festival. I think they did it to try to make your daughter proficient at several task at once but its still a bit wonky. The game can also get weird sometimes. You can feed her breast-expanding pills as early as Year 1 and one of the endings involves you marrying your daughter. Weird stuff..

Overall, a great life simulation game. Probably my favorite, even better than Long Live The Queen in my book.

25773297.review:
tl;dr - Far inferior to the unreleased DOS version.  I can only justify buying this to send a message that the west wants these games.  It's up to you to decide if you want to spend $20 on a worse version of a game from 1993 - along with my hesitant recommendation, I recommend reading into the history of SoftEgg's attempt at bringing the game to the US if you're on the fence.  I may not know how tl;dr works.

Like most of the other reviewers, I played the DOS version of this game a TON when I was growing up.  I consider the story behind that version's failed release to be one of the greatest disappointments in video game history - look into it, if you feel so inclined.  Had the release succeeded, we may well have seen official English releases for many more Gainax titles.  Titles I have never played, and would sorely like to.  The fact that this is actually getting an official release in western markets now, so long after the fact, is surprising.  However, there is one thing that is preventing me from fully embacing this release: the translation.

As others have noted, the translation is vastly inferior to the unreleased DOS version.  The opening text crawl, which you can see on the Store page, has some amazing Engrish (to be fair, nothing else in the game quite reaches that level).  There are grammatical and spelling errors abound, and in a game that is largely text based it's pretty annoying.  In addition, certain stats and skills now have names that don't really make sense.  Charisma has become Glamour, Refinement has become Elegance, and neither of those are really troubling.  But in a game where the religious symbolism is extremely western (crosses and nuns), why has "Sin" become "Karma?"  It doesn't even make any sense.  You actually GAIN karma for doing sinful things, and if I hadn't made the connection to the DOS version, I may have thought that was a good thing.  Also, and this is admittedly a minor point, Conversation is now "Speech."  The skill is basically tracking your daughter's ability to engage in witty conversation with people, so Conversation is far more appropriate.  Speech sounds more like she's learning to speak properly... yet, the only way to increase it is by working at the Bar, and proper speech is actually governed by Decorum.  It's silly.

It makes me sad that such an inferior version of the translation has seen a release that the DOS version never did.  I yearn for the days of the original's nostalgic, pixelized art, though I'm willing to accept that that's more about my own nostalgia - the art isn't really bad.  I think some of the art has altered your daughter's poses as she grows, but that may have something to do with blood type, and I've only played one game, so I can't definitively state that's the case.

Also, another minor point (not so minor?) - going full screen stretches the game's aspect ratio rather than retaining it via a border or something.  It looks terrible, so play windowed.  And why did my daughter stare lovingly at me and speak Japanese to me for 90 seconds upon completion of the game?  There was no text in that segment, which if I recall from the DOS version, was a letter your daughter wrote to you thanking you for all you've done for her.

Honestly, I'm not sure if I want to recommend this.  The unofficial DOS version is better in just about every way.  I don't condone piracy at all, but it's hard to justify paying $20 for an inferior version of a game from the early 90s.  I haven't looked into what the community is doing with this release - if smarter people than I are going to find a way to crack and fix this game, then buy it.  I bought it solely because I want to send a message to the Japanese makers of games like these that there is a market for them in the west.  They're fantastic and I want them.

25762720.review:
首先作为从386时代过来的老玩家，对PM2登陆steam表示欣慰和欢迎。

刨去系列之耻PM4之外，PM2在整个PM系列里可能也是综合表现最佳的一部。PM1系统稚嫩尚不成熟，只后一切对于PM2的改变，PM3求变步子迈得太大（尤其取消了武者修行），PM5过于细致导致拖沓的游戏节奏和过长的游戏时间，最终都成了画蛇添足，反复证明了PM2的经典。

PM2从PC-9801开始发过很多版本，和很多其他经典老游戏一样，跨时空跨语言跨多平台。幸运的是到目前为止，PM2并没有哪次进行过所谓“重制”，而是在尽量保持原味的同时进行修补，当时我是买了盒装版的（还送了PM3的XP版）。玩了一会儿，目测这次steam的refine就是04年的XP绮丽版。
和原始版本相比，绮丽版是改动最大的一版，对所有音画素材都进行了“HD化”，增加配音，并对当时最新的XP系统进行了支持。这次的steam版经测内容和绮丽版一样，在win10 64位下运行正常。
音的部分无可指摘，原本就温和悦耳的旋律经过现代技术重新演绎，增加了听觉部分的质感，语音部分的加入也对游戏的沉浸式体验有所强化。
而画的部分就有一些双刃剑的味道。HD化对整体画质的改善是有目共睹的，但是本身赤井孝美的画风并不是以细腻精美著称，而是有其随意且灵动的特点，原始版本中16色低分辨率渲染出的色阶过度和颗粒感似乎反而更能把赤井的风格体现得淋漓尽致，而HD化之后的精密画质却显得有点“打磨过度”的味道。就像水滴状的钻石美则美矣，但54切面的钻石虽然缺了一分圆润滑腻，却更能显其辉光火彩。当然这也可能是我作为老玩家的记忆和情怀。
PM系列的看家名物“表数值/里数值”在本作已经完成，给看似简单的游戏增加了不少乐趣和变数。
系统和游戏性方面的优点是，除了对最新的操作系统提供支持外，毫无任何变动。确实对完成度高到NINELIVES都不知从何改起的PM2而言，最好的判断恐怕就是一丝一毫都不要改。结果就是老玩家集体买账，顺带说不定还能吸收一些新玩家。
也希望新老玩家可以像我一样，发现或找回PM系列曾经带给我们的投入和感动。

25760673.review:
Finalmente! Una joya de PC-98/DOS al fin disponible en Steam!

Princess Maker 2 es la segunda entrega de la serie del mismo nombre desarrollada por GAINAX (Sí, oyeron bien, los mismos de Neon Genesis Evangelion, Kare Kano, y FLCL, entre otros títulos). En este caso es la versión Refine, relanzada con Gráficos Mejorados, y con Voces en el Japonés original para todos los personajes (salvo tu personaje por obvias razones). La trama del juego es la siguiente: luego de haberte retirado al salvar un reino de un Lord Demonio, recibes poco después un regalo del cielo: una hija! Así que ahora tu nueva misión es cuidar, enseñar, y dirigir a tu hija al cabo de ocho años para que al final se convierta en una Princesa, pero tus acciones determinarán si ella se convertirá en Princesa, o en Guerrera, o en Granjera, o se casará con un noble, o con otra persona...mejor dicho: hay 74 (!!!) posibles finales. Y TODOS dependen de lo que tú hagas desde el día uno.

Los jugadores de más edad tal vez recordarán que este juego tuvo una primera traducción al Inglés para la versión de DOS, pero resultó estar muy incompleta y mal hecha (tipo mala traducción aficionada), pero no se preocupen, porque esta versión está completamente traducida al Inglés!

Para aquellos que les gusten los juegos de simulación, sin importar la edad, este juego se los recomiendo mucho! (Veré a ver cuántos finales saco, este juego da para MUCHO tiempo).

Instead earning more magic rep from accepting challenges, I get housekeeping rep instead.

25760395.review:
I feel like I've waited all my life for this game to see an official English release.

The translation here is quite sketchy (the 1994 DOS vaporware version's translation was much better) and there are certainly other issues (see other reviews mentioning the letter at the end not having subtitles) but anyone who has ever wanted the Princess Maker series in English to pick this baby up. It's just as fun as ever and opens up the possibility of PM3 ~ 5 being translated. I could die happy with these games translated, even as roughly as done here.

No censorship, but there wasn't much to censor from the original Japan-only release of PM2 Refine in 2004. The art was toned down in the original Refine release. No Mad Eddy. Steam overlay doesn't work. Can't screenshot in Steam. There's a bug where Faith reduces to 0 when you sell things out of your inventory when your inventory is maxed.

Release isn't perfect but it works and it's better than nothing. Community has figured out how to edit the game's images day one, I'm sure a method to change the game's text is soon to follow.

[Update Sept 30 2016: CFK are reaching out in a thread in the forum to sniff out bugs and text issues based on player feedback. This is a lot more than I expected from them. Hopefully they fix this release's problems. I'll update this review when/if they do.]

25759619.review:
The moment I saw this title pop up in new releases, my mind said only one thing.

'Shut up and take my money.'

Seriously, this is one of my top 25 favorite games(mostly due to nostalgia). 


Minor story spoilers:

[spoiler] Basically you are the ruler of a kingdom and you have to do your best to raise your daughter in the most responsible(or irresponsible if that is your parenting style) way possible. Depending on what you plan for her daily activities, your daughter can either be obedient or delinquent. There are also many game endings depending on what events you choose to attend/how you train her. She can end up marrying a dragon, becoming a nun, a court magician, and if you're feeling a bit depraved you can sell her into prostitution or marriage. The possibilities seem endless(though that really isn't always a good thing in some cases)!  [/spoiler]

I always really loved this title and spent days of game time goofing around trying to get most of the endings on DOSbox over the years. Now it's on Steam and I am absolutely beyond tickled pink. I've already dusted off the old websites floating around with how to get all the endings and I'm ready to make the best princess that I can! I have always adored management sims and this one was very well done along with a princess theme! What's not to like for a gal like me!? 

I think my only complaint is that I really wish there was a free or endless mode where I can end the game whenever I choose(even if the princess is an old lady).

Thank you for bringing this to Steam!

TL:DR - A blast from the past sim-raiser with plently of secrets and endings to uncover. While showing it's age, the new voice acting is nice and the game is interesting enough that it remains engaging and works as more than just a meseum piece. Recommended

Addendum: All NSFW stuff seems to be present and accounted for, if any old players are concerned about censorship (new players: NSFW stuff is in the form of the occasional artsy nude and brief text descriptions of your daughter getting into morally dubious situations. All the situations are the result of you deliberately playing the game quite badly, as refected in your final result). Only thing missing is Fast Eddy and the Un-dress, which were not present in the 2004 Refine port (of which this is a translation) anyway.

The translations itself is... ok... with the opening scrawl being far and away the worst offender. The actual in-game translation is servicable if ocasssionally stilted. While other people have run into bugs, so far I've not noticed any.


So much nostalgia, and such an unlikely port after 24 years!

PM2 is a stat-raising life sim where you raise a girl from the ages of 10 - 18. Set in a medievil fantasy world, each month your daughter gets three time slots to fill her shedule with; from part-time work, classes, adventuring and rest. These stats vary from combat and magic to social graces and even house work. Final stat levels determine which one of 70-odd endings you receive. Additionally, there are a number of "secrets" that can be triggered by talking certain items to certain placed on the adventure maps, or how you treat certain characters.

25745705.review:
I've played the original DOS version and this new version - Refine.

What I liked about Refine:
+ New Japanese voiceovers.
+ The music sounds much better.
+ New text makes it easier to understand some of the courses/work easier. I first played this game as a child and had a difficult time understanding the terminology in the DOS version. As a result, a child may have an easier time understanding this.
+ The Art is less grainy and more refined; somewhat brighter. The flowers in the vase change by the season – which I thought was a nice touch.
+ 'Olive/Daughter' feels less sexualized in this version.
+ I liked that I could talk to my Daughter multiples times about various things. In the old version it greyed out after one conversation.
UPDATE 2nd play through:
+ The People with bounty on their heads were easier to find this time. In the old version I had to approach the same building multiple times in order to prompt the event.

What I disliked about Refine:
- I'm not sure it was necessary to change the main art for 'Olive/Daughter' in the main gameplay screen. It's not that I dislike the new art, but it felt out of place with the older art. The poses were also different which I don't know if I cared for. The Red Dress seemed rushed compared to the original.
- When I completed the game and had reached the results the DOS version had a letter that your Daughter had written about how she was raised. Refine has a new image with new art of Olive/Daughter and she was speaking in Japanese with no text. Which I believe is just a bug or oversight currently.
- I feel like the new art was made to portray her more as a Daughter and not a potential lover; which is for the better really. However, in the Vacation scenes she is still naked in various scenes and poses. If the art was updated why wasn't that updated as well? She also talks about her bust and butt too from time to time when you talk to her. In the old version she would ask: "Do you think my figure is okay?" from time to time instead of her butt.
- The font that was chosen for the text is not as nice as it was for the old version. It feels cheaper.
- The cheats were taken away. I personally prefer to play without the cheats but sometimes it's nice to mess around. I can understand omitting naked Olive/Daughter.
- The voice overs were repetitive. The P/T pawn shop girl Wendy shouts at you when speaking and it is unpleasant.
- I feel like this could have been an opportunity to add something new to the game play; such as a new course, job, new items. or adventuring area(s) - based on 2 full play thrroughs.
UPDATE 2nd play through:
- (BUG) Your Daughter's Faith reduced to 0 when you took off armor.
- (BUG) The Clown achievement unlocked when I was meant to obtain the perfect hunting achievement.
- The Adverturing areas were still slow moving when moving your Daughter as Day turned into night and back.

Overall, I think this game needs a few fixes but I am very excited and would like to try different routes.
I think you should buy this to support the development of future releases.
